forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Mostly clear, with a low around 53. West southwest wind 10 to 14 mph, with gusts as high as 20 mph.

forecast.name: Juneteenth
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 62, with temperatures falling to around 60 in the afternoon. West wind 9 to 24 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph.

weather_report:
As the twilight settles over Downtown San Francisco, a gentle breeze stirs, signaling the transition into a serene night. The skies are mostly clear, welcoming the evening with a low temperature that hovers around a comforting 53 degrees. The subtle westerly winds, whispering at 10 to 14 miles per hour, create a soothing ambiance, perhaps urging you to venture outdoors for a moment of introspection under the vast expanse of the night sky.

Looking ahead to Juneteenth, a bright promise unfolds on the horizon. A sunny day is anticipated, with the warmth gently rising to a high of around 62 degrees, although an afternoon dip to a cooler 60 will keep things refreshingly delightful. The winds will strengthen, carrying a hint of excitement at 9 to 24 miles per hour, with gusts reaching up to 31—perfect for a lively afternoon stroll along the waterfront or a leisurely exploration of the iconic streets. While the day will likely remain free of fog, the ever-present marine layer may curiously linger at the coastline, with wisps of mist accentuating the Golden Gate's majesty, inviting you to take part in the tranquil beauty of this remarkable city.

As you step out, a light jacket or sweater would serve you well, ensuring comfort without hindrance as you wander. Consider a quiet café for a morning coffee or perhaps a walk through the urban parks, where the vibrant energy of the city mingles with moments of peaceful reflection. As the evening drapes its cool blanket around you, the prominent landmarks sparkle, reminding you of San Francisco's endless charm and allure.
